p: Parallel profiling of cell tolerance and anti-HIV activity in PBMCs showed improved cell tolerance for all derivatives compared to Aureothin. Several fluorine-containing derivatives were identified with similarly potent anti-HIV activity as Aureothin ( #6, #7, #14). Particularly compound #7, which contains a trifluoromethyl- replacing the nitro-group, was most effective in achieving>90% inhibition of HIV infection in PBMCs (IC 90 <45 nM). Substitutions by chlorine (compound #3, #13) resulted in weaker compounds (IC 90 ~2000 to 3000 nM).
